title: Cycling Plus’ Bike of the Year 2023 edition on sale now
content:
The Bike of the Year edition of Cycling Plus is out now, complete with 25 of the year’s greatest bikes on test across the road, gravel, women’s and budget genres.

Cycling Plus also celebrates the joy of riding at night, rates the best cycling backpacks and discovers the small positional tweaks with the biggest rewards on the bike.

If you subscribe today you’ll save 50 per cent on the shop price.

Bike of the Year 2023

Cycling Plus has selected the best 25 bikes of 2023 in the budget, endurance, women’s-specific, gravel, aero and performance genres. Historic brands, major sellers and newer kids on the block are all present and correct, but which six bikes will take the category honours? And who will come out on top as the overall Bike of the Year?

Women’s Bike of the Year 2023

Should you go for a women’s-specific build or adapt a unisex model? Cycling Plus put three female-targeting options from Scott, Liv and Ribble to the test on the ascents and descents of Dartmoor.

Gravel Bike of the Year 2023

Grit, gravel, asphalt and multi-day rides. Cycling Plus‘ fistful of all-terrain monsters look to handle it all and more. But which will be the gravel bike of 2023?

Essential upgrades

Cycling Plus‘ buyer’s guide this month is on the best cycling backpacks for commuting and/or all-day adventures. Cycling Plus also rates Bell’s new Falcon XR helmet, top women’s kit, pedals and budget bikepacking kit.

Join the dark side?

Whether in the depth of winter or height of summer, riding at night offers a sensory experience all of its own. Will Cycling Plus‘ feature make you turn to the dark side?

Music and cycling

Dom Whiting has combined his loves of cycling and drum and bass music and turned them into hugely popular city rides. Cycling Plus joins one in Bristol to see what all the fuss is about and selects the greatest cycling-themed songs in history.

Training Zone

Cycling Plus‘ new look Training Zone section answers your common cycling questions, provides healthy and energising recipes, and gives winning advice on the small bike changes that can reap the biggest rewards. Plus, there’s a six-week training plan to get you ready to race this summer.

Subscription offer

Whether you’re looking at investing in a new bike, trying a different kind of cycling or searching for new gear to make those days on the road more comfortable, Cycling Plus is the magazine for you.

You’ll find inspiring features from across the UK and around the world on every page, plus interviews with the movers and shakers in cycling.

Remember, subscribe today to save 50 per cent on the shop price.

Otherwise, check out the Cycling Plus Facebook, Instagram and Twitter accounts for all of the latest news from the magazine team.
